data.text:
Juan II, Rey de Aragón y Navarre1

M, #113271, b. 29 June 1398, d. 19 January 1479

Last Edited=28 Aug 2005

Consanguinity Index=5.36%

Juan II, Rey de Aragón y Navarre was born on 29 June 1398. He was the son of Fernando I de Antequera, Rey de Aragón and Eleanor de Albuquerque.2 He married, firstly, Blanche II, Reina de Navarre, daughter of Carlos III, Rey de Navarre and Eleanor de Castilla, in 1420.1 He married Juana Henriques, daughter of Frederick Henriques, Conde de Melgar and Merina de Cordova, in July 1447.3 He died on 19 January 1479 at age 80.

He succeeded as the Rey Juan II de Navarre in 1425.1 He succeeded as the Rey Juan II de Aragón in 1458.1

Children of Juan II, Rey de Aragón y Navarre and Blanche II, Reina de Navarre

Eleanor, Reina de Navarre+1 b. 1420, d. 1479

Blanche de Aragón2 b. 1420, d. 1464

Carlos de Aragón, Principe de Viana2 b. 1421, d. 1461

Child of Juan II, Rey de Aragón y Navarre and Juana Henriques

Fernando II, Rey de España+ b. 10 Mar 1452, d. 25 Jan 1516

Citations

[S16] Jirí Louda and Michael MacLagan, Lines of Succession: Heraldry of the Royal Families of Europe, 2nd edition (London, U.K.: Little, Brown and Company, 1999), table 44. Hereinafter cited as Lines of Succession.

[S16] Louda and MacLagan, Lines of Succession, table 48.

[S16] Louda and MacLagan, Lines of Succession, table 53.

Eleanor, Reina de Navarre1

F, #113272, b. 1420, d. 1479

Last Edited=21 Nov 2014

Consanguinity Index=6.57%

Eleanor, Reina de Navarre was born in 1420.1 She was the daughter of Juan II, Rey de Aragón y Navarre and Blanche II, Reina de Navarre.1 She married Gaston IV de Grailly, Comte de Foix, son of Jean de Grailly, Comte de Foix and Joan d'Evreux, in 1436.1 She died in 1479.1

She succeeded as the Reina Eleanor de Navarre in 1479.1

Children of Eleanor, Reina de Navarre and Gaston IV de Grailly, Comte de Foix

Gaston, Comte de Foix+ b. 1444, d. 1470

Marguerite de Foix+2 b. 1449, d. 1486

Catherine de Foix+3 b. c 1455, d. b 1494

Citations

[S16] Jirí Louda and Michael MacLagan, Lines of Succession: Heraldry of the Royal Families of Europe, 2nd edition (London, U.K.: Little, Brown and Company, 1999), table 44. Hereinafter cited as Lines of Succession.

[S3409] Caroline Maubois, "re: Penancoet Family," e-mail message to Darryl Roger Lundy, 2 December 2008. Hereinafter cited as "re: Penancoet Family."

[S130] Wikipedia, online http;//www.wikipedia.org. Hereinafter cited as Wikipedia.

Beatrice d'Evreux1

F, #113273, d. before 1415

Last Edited=24 Jul 2005

Consanguinity Index=1.21%

Citations

[S16] Jirí Louda and Michael MacLagan, Lines of Succession: Heraldry of the Royal Families of Europe, 2nd edition (London, U.K.: Little, Brown and Company, 1999), table 44. Hereinafter cited as Lines of Succession.

James II de Bourbon, Comte de Marche1

M, #113274, b. 1370, d. 1438

Last Edited=16 Jul 2005

James II de Bourbon, Comte de Marche was born in 1370.2 He was the son of Jean I de Bourbon, Comte de Marche et Vendôme and Catherine de Vendôme.1 He married Beatrice d'Evreux, daughter of Carlos III, Rey de Navarre and Eleanor de Castilla, in 1406.2 He married Joanna II d'Anjou, Queen of Naples, daughter of Charles III d'Anjou, King of Naples and Margaret of Durazzo, in 1415.1 He died in 1438.2

He gained the title of Comte de Marche.1

Citations

[S16] Jirí Louda and Michael MacLagan, Lines of Succession: Heraldry of the Royal Families of Europe, 2nd edition (London, U.K.: Little, Brown and Company, 1999), table 68. Hereinafter cited as Lines of Succession.

[S16] Louda and MacLagan, Lines of Succession, table 44.

Last Edited=24 Jul 2005

Consanguinity Index=1.21%

Citations

Jean IV d'Armagnac, Comte d'Armagnac1

M, #113276, d. 1450

Last Edited=19 May 2003

Jean IV d'Armagnac, Comte d'Armagnac married Isabella d'Evreux, daughter of Carlos III, Rey de Navarre and Eleanor de Castilla, in 1419.1 He died in 1450.1

He gained the title of Comte d'Armagnac.1

Citations

[S16] Jirí Louda and Michael MacLagan, Lines of Succession: Heraldry of the Royal Families of Europe, 2nd edition (London, U.K.: Little, Brown and Company, 1999), table 44. Hereinafter cited as Lines of Succession.

Beatrice, Comtesse de Provence1

F, #113277, b. 1234, d. circa July 1267

Last Edited=11 Jul 2005

Consanguinity Index=0.12%

Beatrice, Comtesse de Provence was born in 1234.1 She was the daughter of Raimond Berengar V, Comte de Provence and Beatrice di Savoia.1 She married Charles I Stephen d'Anjou, King of Naples and Sicily, son of Louis VIII, Roi de France and Blanca de Castilla, in 1246.1 She died circa July 1267 at Nocera . She was buried at Roque-Pymont .

She succeeded as the Comtesse de Provence in 1245.2

Children of Beatrice, Comtesse de Provence and Charles I Stephen d'Anjou, King of Naples and Sicily

Louis d'Anjou b. 1248, d. 1248

Blanche d'Anjou+3 b. c 1250, d. 1269

Beatrix d'Anjou+3 b. c 1252, d. 1275

Charles II d'Anjou, King of Naples+3 b. 1254, d. 6 May 1309

Philip d'Anjou, King of Thessaloniki3 b. 1256, d. 1277

Robert d'Anjou b. c 1258, d. 1265

Isabel of Sicily3 b. c 1261, d. bt 1290 - 1304

Citations

[S16] Jirí Louda and Michael MacLagan, Lines of Succession: Heraldry of the Royal Families of Europe, 2nd edition (London, U.K.: Little, Brown and Company, 1999), table 45. Hereinafter cited as Lines of Succession.

[S38] John Morby, Dynasties of the World: a chronological and genealogical handbook (Oxford, Oxfordshire, U.K.: Oxford University Press, 1989), page 87. Hereinafter cited as Dynasties of the World.

[S16] Louda and MacLagan, Lines of Succession, table 124.

Alfonso II, Comte de Provence1

M, #113278, b. circa 1177, d. February 1209

Last Edited=11 Jul 2005

Consanguinity Index=0.19%

Alfonso II, Comte de Provence was born circa 1177. He was the son of Alfonso II Raimond, Rey de Aragón and Sanchia de Castilla.1 He married Gersend de Sabran, Comtesse de Forcalquier, daughter of Rainier I de Sabran, Seigneur de Castellar and Gersend de Forcalquier, Comtesse de Forcalquier, in July 1193 at Aix-en-Provence, Provence, France . He died in February 1209.

He succeeded as the Comte de Provence in 1196.1

Child of Alfonso II, Comte de Provence and Gersend de Sabran, Comtesse de Forcalquier

Raimond Berengar V, Comte de Provence+1 b. c 1198, d. 19 Aug 1245

Citations

[S16] Jirí Louda and Michael MacLagan, Lines of Succession: Heraldry of the Royal Families of Europe, 2nd edition (London, U.K.: Little, Brown and Company, 1999), table 45. Hereinafter cited as Lines of Succession.

Gersend de Sabran, Comtesse de Forcalquier

F, #113279, d. after November 1209

Last Edited=30 May 2008

Gersend de Sabran, Comtesse de Forcalquier was the daughter of Rainier I de Sabran, Seigneur de Castellar and Gersend de Forcalquier, Comtesse de Forcalquier.1 She married Alfonso II, Comte de Provence, son of Alfonso II Raimond, Rey de Aragón and Sanchia de Castilla, in July 1193 at Aix-en-Provence, Provence, France . She died after November 1209.

She gained the title of Comtesse de Forcalquier.

Child of Gersend de Sabran, Comtesse de Forcalquier and Alfonso II, Comte de Provence

Raimond Berengar V, Comte de Provence+1 b. c 1198, d. 19 Aug 1245

Citations

[S16] Jirí Louda and Michael MacLagan, Lines of Succession: Heraldry of the Royal Families of Europe, 2nd edition (London, U.K.: Little, Brown and Company, 1999), table 45. Hereinafter cited as Lines of Succession.
